intro: Mesanthemum angustitepalum, commonly known as the narrow-leaf mesanthemum, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in coastal and rocky habitats, thriving in well-drained soils. Its narrow, linear leaves and small yellow flowers make it a distinctive species within its native range. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and resilience in arid conditions.
